articles.title: Face recognition struggles to recognise us after five years of ageing
articles.description: As we age, our faces change, becoming slowly different from images used for facial recognition – so new photos may be needed more frequently to maintain accuracy and security
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
Our face changes faster when we are young or old
Base image: Karras, T. et al. Age processing: Alaluf, Y. et al.
We can age as little as five years before face-recognition algor… [+391 chars]

articles.title: Most plant milks are lower in key micronutrients than cow's milk
articles.description: Phosphorous, magnesium, zinc and selenium are lacking in most plant milks, except pea milk which has similar or higher levels than cow’s milk
articles.content:
By Clare Wilson
A wide range of vegan milk alternatives are available
carlosgaw/Getty Images

articles.title: Heatwave in China is the most severe ever recorded in the world
articles.description: A long spell of extreme hot and dry weather is affecting energy, water supplies and food production across China

articles.title: AI-created lenses let camera ignore some objects when taking pictures
articles.description: Camera lenses that ignore certain objects and only capture images they have been designed to recognise can be built in just hours from clear plastic with a 3D printer
articles.content:
By Matthew Sparkes
These 3D-printed lenses can ignore certain objects in frame
Bijie Bai et al.

articles.title: Earthquakes seem to come in a more predictable pattern than we thought
articles.description: A machine learning algorithm can assess how likely it is that a large earthquake will hit a region over the next few years, which could one day help mitigate damage from future quakes
articles.content:
By Alex Wilkins
Earthquakes can lead to fires as well as other destruction
Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

articles.title: Supercharging tweak could fill electric car batteries 90% in 10 mins
articles.description: A modification to the way electric cars are charged could allow them to get 90 per cent battery from nothing in just 10 minutes. A standard approach would take half an hour
articles.content:
By Jeremy Hsu
Normally, electric cars are charged slowly at first before ramping up the power

articles.title: 3D-printed wood could start flat then twist into furniture as it dries
articles.description: A 3D printing method that uses ink made of wood pulp can be used to make flat objects that morph into 3D shapes as they dry
articles.content:

articles.title: Plasmas could be used to make the world's most powerful laser
articles.description: Because plasma can shape very intense light without being damaged, it could be used to make components for lasers thousands of times more powerful than the strongest ones that exist
